Hydras:

Hydras smiles when he heard Maxima, but he didn't anything




--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> In a message dated 7/21/03 8:40:47 AM Central Daylight Time, 
> Proudwing500k@h... writes:
> 
> 
> > Tyrael: Now we can talk. As I said, this might not please you 
very 
> > much, but neither am I hot to the idea. I was sent here to get 
you, 
> > alive or dead. What I suggest is that you leave, in exile. You 
can 
> > still have contacts with your crew, which I do not necessarily 
wish 
> > to see evicted, but the main thing is that you are not on Earth 
> > anymore. We will not chase you or anything, unless you come 
back. If 
> > you wish, you can negotiate to accomodate yourself.
> > 
> > Dreadplague looked at Tyrael with a struck air, then at 
Darkangel. 
> > Her voice came out so low that only her fellow warrior could 
hear her.
> > 
> > Dread: Is he crazy? What is he doing?
> > 
> > 
> 
> Maxima was stunned. It appeared that she was breathing heavily, as 
her 
> crimson optics widened slightly & glared at Tyrael. Barely able to 
keep her ground, 
> her claws dug into the ground. Forgetting about her wounds, the 
piercing in 
> her lasercore to lose Hydras was far worse. 
> 
> Growling angerly, like the wild, wounded animal she was. Then 
moved up, in 
> tiger form, next to Hydras. "We will NEVER leave his side. Not 
now... not ever," 
> growling evilly at such a suggestion. Her long black & white 
striped tail 
> flicked hard back & forth behind her.
